Animator Job at KOKO TV Nigeria




        
    

        
        KOKO TV Nigeria is part of the KOKO Internet Group, an international media, fashion, and services company. The group operates businesses across Europe and Africa, offering diverse opportunities and experiences. KOKO TV Nigeria is a dynamic and innovative company, providing a range of media and fashion-related content.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Animator

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Description
     

            
    




	This is a full-time role for an Animator at KOKO TV Nigeria.
	The Animator will be responsible for creating animations, motion graphics, and utilizing motion capture technologies.
	Daily tasks include storyboarding and collaborating with the creative team to develop engaging content.
	This on-site role is based in Lagos State, Nigeria.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Animation, Graphic Design, Fine Arts, or related field is preferred
	Proficiency in Animation and Motion Graphics
	Experience with Motion Capture technology
	Skills in Storyboarding and visual storytelling
	Strong Communication skills
	Attention to detail and creativity
	Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
	Experience in the media and entertainment industry is a plus.

  "description": "Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational technology company with headquarters in Redmond, Washington. It develops, manufactures, licenses, supports, and sells computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers, and related services. Its best known software products are the Microsoft Windows line of operating systems, the Microsoft Office suite, and the Internet Explorer and Edge web browsers.&nbsp;

At Microsoft, our mission and values are to help people and businesses throughout the world realize their full potential.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Cloud Solution Architect - D365 F&amp;O

Job number:&nbsp;1855603
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria

Overview


	As a Cloud Solution Architect specialising in Dynamics 365 Finance &amp; Operations (F&amp;O), you&rsquo;ll lead transformative cloud migrations across the Middle East and Africa.
	This is a rare opportunity to as the sole F&amp;O professional in the region to drive impact through the design and integration of complex systems into the Dynamics 365 ecosystem.&nbsp;
	You&rsquo;ll work across multiple countries, delivering high-value solutions that help customers modernise legacy platforms and realise tangible ROI.
	With a blend of remote and on-site engagements, this role offers both flexibility and the chance to build deep relationships across diverse markets.
	You&rsquo;ll be at the forefront of Microsoft&rsquo;s AI and cloud transformation, collaborating with top-tier partners and vendors to shape the future of enterprise systems.&nbsp;


Responsibilities


	Use customer insights to align Business Applications solutions with business outcomes, accelerating delivery and adoption through value-based engagements and reusable IP.&nbsp;
	Deliver technical sessions and workshops to support customer skilling, operational health, and cloud readiness.&nbsp;
	Share customer feedback with internal Microsoft teams to drive product and service improvements.&nbsp;
	Guide decision-makers to realise value from Microsoft technology through solution optimisation, performance efficiency, and operational excellence.&nbsp;
	Resolve blockers preventing go-live or broad usage by applying technical, functional, and project management expertise using Microsoft best practices and IP.&nbsp;
	Identify growth opportunities by matching customer needs with Microsoft Business Applications capabilities and value propositions.&nbsp;
	Continuously develop skills to better support customer and Microsoft business goals.&nbsp;
	Share expertise in communities, contribute to IP creation, and reuse assets to accelerate customer transformation.&nbsp;


Qualifications


	To succeed in this role, candidates must demonstrate strong technical expertise, practical experience, and a solid understanding of Microsoft Business Applications, particularly Dynamics 365 Finance &amp; Operations (F&amp;O).


You will be able to demonstrate the following:&nbsp;


	Prior experience as a?Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), engaging with stakeholders at all levels within enterprise organisations to drive solution adoption, transformation, and business impact.&nbsp;
	Experience conducting?Business Value Assessments (BVA)?and be confident leading?ROI-focused conversations?that demonstrate the strategic impact of Dynamics 365 Finance &amp; Operations solutions&nbsp;
	Experience engaging with?senior stakeholders, including?C-suite executives, to influence strategic decisions and drive enterprise-wide solution adoption.&nbsp;


Technical knowledge&nbsp;
Dynamics 365 Finance &amp; Operations (F&amp;O):


	Deep technical expertise in?Dynamics 365 F&amp;O, including development experience in?X++?across at least two modules: sales, services, marketing, or customer insights.&nbsp;
	Proven ability in?debugging and performance troubleshooting, including use of?Trace Parser.&nbsp;
	Solid understanding of?performance patterns and anti-patterns.&nbsp;


Architecture &amp; Lifecycle Management:


	Strong grasp of?Microsoft Azure?cloud computing fundamentals.&nbsp;
	Knowledge of how?Dynamics 365 F&amp;O?interacts with?Azure components.&nbsp;
	Familiarity with?integration patterns and anti-patterns?across Business Applications.&nbsp;
	Experience with?Azure DevOps?for application lifecycle management.&nbsp;
	Proficiency in?Microsoft Lifecycle Services?for environment setup and troubleshooting.&nbsp;
	Ability to set up and execute the?Regression Suite Automation Tool.&nbsp;


Cross-Platform Integration:


	Understanding of integration between?Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE)?and?Finance &amp; Supply Chain?platforms.&nbsp;

Cloud Solution Architect Job at Microsoft Corporation




        
    

        
        Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational technology company with headquarters in Redmond, Washington. It develops, manufactures, licenses, supports, and sells computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers, and related services. Its best known software products are the Microsoft Windows line of operating systems, the Microsoft Office suite, and the Internet Explorer and Edge web browsers. 

At Microsoft, our mission and values are to help people and businesses throughout the world realize their full potential.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cloud Solution Architect - D365 F&O

Job number: 1855603
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
     

            
    



Overview


	As a Cloud Solution Architect specialising in Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O), you’ll lead transformative cloud migrations across the Middle East and Africa.
	This is a rare opportunity to as the sole F&O professional in the region to drive impact through the design and integration of complex systems into the Dynamics 365 ecosystem. 
	You’ll work across multiple countries, delivering high-value solutions that help customers modernise legacy platforms and realise tangible ROI.
	With a blend of remote and on-site engagements, this role offers both flexibility and the chance to build deep relationships across diverse markets.
	You’ll be at the forefront of Microsoft’s AI and cloud transformation, collaborating with top-tier partners and vendors to shape the future of enterprise systems. 


Responsibilities


	Use customer insights to align Business Applications solutions with business outcomes, accelerating delivery and adoption through value-based engagements and reusable IP. 
	Deliver technical sessions and workshops to support customer skilling, operational health, and cloud readiness. 
	Share customer feedback with internal Microsoft teams to drive product and service improvements. 
	Guide decision-makers to realise value from Microsoft technology through solution optimisation, performance efficiency, and operational excellence. 
	Resolve blockers preventing go-live or broad usage by applying technical, functional, and project management expertise using Microsoft best practices and IP. 
	Identify growth opportunities by matching customer needs with Microsoft Business Applications capabilities and value propositions. 
	Continuously develop skills to better support customer and Microsoft business goals. 
	Share expertise in communities, contribute to IP creation, and reuse assets to accelerate customer transformation. 


Qualifications


	To succeed in this role, candidates must demonstrate strong technical expertise, practical experience, and a solid understanding of Microsoft Business Applications, particularly Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O).


You will be able to demonstrate the following: 


	Prior experience as a?Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), engaging with stakeholders at all levels within enterprise organisations to drive solution adoption, transformation, and business impact. 
	Experience conducting?Business Value Assessments (BVA)?and be confident leading?ROI-focused conversations?that demonstrate the strategic impact of Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations solutions 
	Experience engaging with?senior stakeholders, including?C-suite executives, to influence strategic decisions and drive enterprise-wide solution adoption. 


Technical knowledge 
Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O):


	Deep technical expertise in?Dynamics 365 F&O, including development experience in?X++?across at least two modules: sales, services, marketing, or customer insights. 
	Proven ability in?debugging and performance troubleshooting, including use of?Trace Parser. 
	Solid understanding of?performance patterns and anti-patterns. 


Architecture & Lifecycle Management:


	Strong grasp of?Microsoft Azure?cloud computing fundamentals. 
	Knowledge of how?Dynamics 365 F&O?interacts with?Azure components. 
	Familiarity with?integration patterns and anti-patterns?across Business Applications. 
	Experience with?Azure DevOps?for application lifecycle management. 
	Proficiency in?Microsoft Lifecycle Services?for environment setup and troubleshooting. 
	Ability to set up and execute the?Regression Suite Automation Tool. 


Cross-Platform Integration:


	Understanding of integration between?Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE)?and?Finance & Supply Chain?platforms.

title: Job Vacancies at Nina Jojer Limited
content:
Nina Jojer Limited is a leading human resources organization in Nigeria. It also has a policy advocacy advisory division and an IT/Telecom division. It is a firm known for its effective and innovative solutions, backed by a robust network within many sectors. We claim to be the largest aggregator service in Nigeria. Over the years, Nina Jojer has cultivated in-house expertise to offer tailored services to clients. To facilitate smooth operations for our clients across Sub-Saharan Africa, we have fostered strong partnerships. In parallel, we uphold stringent adherence to global best practices.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Data Analytics and Dashboard Consultant
     

            
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Summary


	To effectively track progress and inform decision-making for the 200 PHCs Revitalization Project, dedicated support is needed to manage monitoring data, develop user-friendly dashboards, and generate technical insights. The consultant will strengthen real-time reporting and ensure project teams have access to timely, accurate information.


Job Details
Main Responsibilities and Tasks:


	Collect and compile monitoring data from field engineers and partners.
	Clean and organize data for analysis and reporting.
	Develop and maintain interactive dashboards to track project implementation (e.g., facility handover, construction progress, equipment delivery).
	Generate regular summary reports and insights to inform planning and reviews.
	Support coordination with field teams to improve data quality and timeliness.


Deliverables:


	Interactive project dashboard (initial version + regular updates)
	Frequent (Daily/Weekly/Fortnightly/monthly/quarterly) data summary and progress reports
	Cleaned and structured datasets
	Technical briefings on project trends and implementation status
	End-of-assignment report with recommendations


Requirements
Education:


	Degree in Data Science, Financing, Economics, Public Health, Statistics, or related field


Language:


	English


Work Experience:


	Experience in data analysis and dashboard development (Power BI, Excel, etc.)
	Strong understanding of monitoring systems and project reporting.
	Excellent coordination and communication skills.
	Prior experience with health or infrastructure projects is an advantage


Application Closing Date: 20th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers.ninajojer@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Health Consultant, Public Health Emergency and Resilient PHC

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Nigeria faces poor health outcomes and incessant outbreaks of (vaccine) preventable diseases. For the past three years, Nigeria has been grappling with its worst diphtheria outbreak in decades, with an estimated 43,983 cases and 1,385 deaths from 2022 till date. Between January 1 and May 22, 2025, Nigeria reported 1,307 suspected cholera cases across 30 states and 98 Local Government Areas (LGAs).
	Outbreaks of Mpox, measles, and meningitis have occurred across States, in cyclical period, in the last decade.
	Climate change related emergencies – floods and droughts – remain of huge concern, worsening already weak health systems and exacerbating morbidities and mortalities across Nigeria.
	UNICEF supports the government of Nigeria in primary health systems development, disease prevention (including immunization), and outbreak response. Through a comprehensive multi-sectoral approach, UNICEF programs aim to build resilient primary health care systems that enable outbreak risk mapping, preparedness, and response through support to national and state authorities.
	A Public Health Emergency and Resilient PHC Consultant is needed to support effective support in the PHE program area.
	The Consultant will work within the Health Systems Strengthening Cluster to support coordination of the multi-sectoral support program.


Main Responsibilities and Tasks


	Contribute to national reports on emerging and ongoing public health events, including climate-related crises (floods, drought), disease outbreaks (mpox, cholera) VPDs), and cross-border health issues, providing recommendations for UNICEF’s focus.
	Support the development and use of risk assessment tools in priority states experiencing crises, supporting risk-informed planning and risk
	mapping at the national and subnational levels.
	Collaborate with national, state, development partners’ health emergency focal points and partners to conduct risk assessments, develop analytics and dashboards on health emergency risks and provide regular updates to UNICEF
	Contribute to review and update of national and UNICEF’s SoP for public health emergencies.
	Support planning and coordination of UNICEF’s multisectoral responses to public health emergencies in accordance with the programs SoP.
	Support forecasting, procurement, prepositioning, and tracking of essential outbreak response supplies for UNICEF-supported PHE program.
	Contribute to drafting of UNICEF’s quarterly country and state specific PHE reports.
	Contribute to development of integrated PHE resilience plans within primary health care systems.
	Support resource mobilization efforts for PHEs in Nigeria.


Deliverables:


	Weekly national (and State specific) PHE sitreps.
	Updated quarterly outbreak risk assessment tools for Nigeria and States.
	Monthly updates of national Incident Action Plans for ongoing outbreaks.
	Integrated national and State outbreak response reports.
	Monthly NCDC PHE Technical Committee meetings reports


Requirements
Education:


	Master’s degree, or its equivalent in any of the following areas: Epidemiology, Public Health, Health Sciences, Health Education and Promotion, Health systems, psychology, Sociology and Social Sciences or another related field.


Language:


	Fluency in English language and writing skills


Work Experience:


	At least 5 years of experience in PHC and Emergency management, disease surveillance and outbreak response programming at national and sub-national levels.
	Solid experience multi-sectorial coordination, Results-Based Measurement and in health programme monitoring and evaluation.


Application Closing Date: 15th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers.ninajojer@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) State Health Facilitator

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	In partnership with the China Export-Import (EXIM) Bank and CGCOC Group, UNICEF is supporting the Government of Nigeria to deliver a comprehensive approach to water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) and primary health care in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT). Building on the Abuja Water Supply Project—which provides piped water to over 1.5 million residents, this new programme, implemented through UNICEF, aims to amplify the social impact of the existing infrastructure.
	By combining reliable water supply with robust sanitation and hygiene services, health system strengthening, and community engagement, the initiative seeks to improve the health and well-being of vulnerable households, pregnant women, newborns and children.
	In alignment with Nigeria’s national development strategies and global commitments to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), the partnership represents a significant opportunity to contribute towards achieving SDGs 3, 6, and 17, ensuring a safer, more equitable, and sustainable future for communities across the FCT.
	The State Health Facilitator is the focal point of UNICEF’s technical assistance to FCTA health department towards the delivery of the initiative. He further performs coordination and liaison roles for the initiative, representing UNICEF’s interests and priorities towards effective partnership for the intervention.


Main Responsibilities and Tasks


	Provide technical support to FCT management towards the effective implementation of the Strengthening Inclusive Health Outcomes through an
	Integrated WASH and Health Programme in the Federal Capital Territory
	Support the planning, implementation, and monitoring of PHC programs/interventions in FCT, its LGAs, and communities: Support the development
	of project specific work plans as integral to the overall FCT AoPs.
	Support multi-sectoral PHC programming in FCT, including integration with WaSH, nutrition, SBC, and child protection.
	Work with FCTA to conduct evidence based PHC performance review for FCT.
	Contribute to the development of data-related capacity, tools, evidence generation and/or systems for programme monitoring and learning plan
	Contribute to the implementation of all UNICEGF supported programs in FCTA, including PHC Leadership challenge, immunization and RMNCAH
	programs.
	Contribute to the tracking and reporting of public health emergencies, and to the execution of FCTA PHE response plan.
	Render monthly program updates and implementation reports for PHC delivery in FCT, including reporting, documentation and development of
	program-related knowledge products.


Deliverables


	Program workplan with detailed Implementation Gantt chart.
	Monthly program updates and quarterly reports of the multisectoral intervention.
	Monthly FCT HMIS reports, including evidence of complete reporting from all FCT HFs.
	Updated monthly PHC implementation dashboard.
	Quertaerly (monthly during outbreaks) PHE surveillance reports


Requirements
Educational Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree, or its equivalent in any of the following areas: Public Health, Health Sciences, Health Education and Promotion, Biological sciences, Psychology, Sociology and Social Sciences or another related field
